conbody.p: This chapter contains the procedures that describe how to scale a VNF in OpenStack or VMware environments.

section.p: Scaling means increasing or decreasing the number of specified VMs based on the resources that are needed. Scale-in decreases the number of resources running if the traffic is sufficiently low to recognize that fewer resources are required, thereby giving back unused resources to the datacenter pool. Scale-out increases the number of VMs for a chosen VM type to provide additional capacity. Scale-in and scale-out can be done manually or as a scheduled maintenance operation in CBAM called auto-scale.
